definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: They lazed away the long summer days.
sentences.chinese: 他們懶懶散散地混過了漫長的夏天。

sentences.english: He wasn't ill; he stayed in bed from laziness.
sentences.chinese: 他沒病，躺在牀上是因懶散之故。

sentences.english: They lazed away the whole afternoon.
Some authors even have started  condoning this laid-back approach.
sentences.chinese: 一些作者甚至開始寬恕這種懶散的作風。

sentences.english: Let a man who does not wish to become slothful, fall in love.
sentences.chinese: 讓不願懶散度日的男人沈醉於愛情吧。

sentences.english: A parliament is nothing less than a big meeting of more or less idle people.
sentences.chinese: 議會無非是多少有些懶散的人們的一個大聚會。

sentences.english: His son has been lazing about too much lately.

sentences.chinese: 懶散的管園人立即答應了。

sentences.english: I was being lazy and now I am very stressed out.
sentences.chinese: 我當時太懶散了，現在卻要被逼瘋了。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懶散能磨去才智的鋒芒。

sentences.english: Slouches towards Bethlehem to be born?
sentences.chinese: 懶散的踏向伯利恆的投生？

sentences.english: It's lovely just to laze away in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光下懶散一會兒真是太舒服了。

sentences.english: Are you on the edge of your seat or slouching ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否坐在你位子的邊緣或懶散的？

sentences.english: Is peaceful to live , is waiting for the appearance of real love.
sentences.chinese: 回到沒有她以前的樣子，懶懶散散的認真活着。

sentences.english: Sloth tarnishes the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懶散能磨去才智的矛頭。

sentences.english: Slouchy denim bucket shape with suede trim.
sentences.chinese: 懶散麂皮鑲邊的牛仔桶形狀。

definition: to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
